text: Jet black pour with a single finger espresso head with lace. Aroma is fruity with a hint of citrus. Full bodied and very flavorful. Finish is dry, roasted malt and pine. Slightly honeyed biscuit notes creep in. Tons of flavor going on here. This is not just a dark beer with a bunch of hops. A very well thought out black IPA.

650ml bottle shared with Ky from ck1, thx bro! Almost black pour with a beige head. Aroma has sweet and black malts, citrus and honey and perhaps chocolate. Taste is of well blended sweet malts, honey and citrus, with a touch of tangy black malts. Well done and well blended. Finishes the way a black ipa should; hoppy bittersweet. This is excellent; not Self-Righteous, but different and very well done in its way. 17

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, dank hops, pine/resin, cocoa, & citrus; Flavor of roasted malt, pine hops, chocolate, some caramel/honey, and citrus; Finish is fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; Quite pungent aroma - very good!

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an average beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, citrus and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice BIPA indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
galaxy hopped black IIPA has a little tropical nose and the roastiness is perfect on the tongue.

Bottle. Pours opaque black, medium creamy brown head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, citrus, pine. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, roasty and citrus. Medium body, a bit of acidity. Tasty.
Bottle from Binnys Southloop. Poured black with light tan head. Aroma molassass malt citrus. Light carb med thick bod. Tastes light bitter plenty of rich roast malt. Nice
Black pour from 22oz bottle at home, tons of creamy brown head. Cocoa, malts, fruits and bitter aroma. Taste is chocolate, bitter, hoppy and has a sweet finish. Excellent brew

Bottle. Aromas are flowers, pine, light roast, and light citrus. Tastes a like moderate roast, strong pine, flowers, and a touch of honey. Light sweetness from the honey. Moderately bitter finish with lingering roasted coffee. Really good.

No batch number. Hooray new brewery. So 2nd batch. Black. Hoppy, malty. Slight floral, pine, somewhat smokey malt. Good amount of hops for the style. Nice malt and hop balance. Glad it isnÂ’t the heavy like most are. Pretty damn good black IPA.

amazing nose on this beer. Aromas of passion fruit and hoops. Also very citruscy and hoppy flavored are bursting from this one. You would never guess it by the black color it pours. Has a thin tan head. Looks like a porter. Awesome beer guys

Many thanks to Mark for hauling this bottle over the ocean! Pours opaque black with a tan head. The smell is fruit, citrus, roasted malt, licorice. The taste starts out with some tropical fruit sweetness, citrus, roast, licorice ending mixed fruity and dry. Medium+ in body and nicely carbonated. A treat!

Location: Bottle shared at Max and AndyÂ’s Tasting, 2/28/15


Aroma: It has a nice hoppy aroma, resiny, pine, and lightly sweet/roast as well

Appearance: Brown in color, with a small head on it, and some fairly heavy lace

Flavor: Hops over malts flavor wise, similar to the nose from a component perspective

Palate: This one has a nice, smooth, mouthfeel, with a dry finish

Overall Impression:
Pretty solid one overall. Definitely leans toward the hoppy side for the style, which works quite nicely

Bottle shared at the FF tasting. Poured a deep black medium density body with a large foamy light beige head. Aroma/flavor of burnt citrus fruits, roastiness, some molasses sweetness as well. Medium body with smooth carbonation and a slightly creamy mouthfeel.
Bottle. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of honey, resin, roast chocolate, citrus peel and pine. Medium body.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Herbal and grassy aromas. Roasted and light grassy and herbal hop flavors.

Bottle: Near opaque with nice beige head and good lace. Resiny, dank, tropical and herbal hops marry with roasted nuts, mocha java, and dark breads to create a nice darkened DIPA. The mouth feel is somewhat aggressive but not overly so, a tad ashy and sticky too. I do prefer my Black a but less sweet and a bit more roasty but this will easily do in a pinch. I would drink it again.

Purchased at BinnyÂ’s in Chicago, IL; enjoyed on a nice January Sunday while watching final playoff football. Appearance is a creamy pitch black with a rich tan head that lightly laces to the glass. Aroma is huge with piney hops and sweet notes from the chocolate and honey, smell is fantastic. Taste is real good, very real good, tropical fruit notes with roasted chocolate, coffee, honey, well done. This may be one of my fav Pipeworks brews.

Deuce to snifter (Batch 604/605; shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a mostly opaque very dark, dull cola with foamy beige head. Smells good too; dark malt, chocolate, roast, and bitter and piney hops with a nicely balanced honey sweetness. Tastes like it smells with a medium full-bodied mouthfeel. Some soft floral notes. Smooth and bitter. Great stuff.

650ml bottle dark blackish brown pour frothy tan colored head. Aroma is sweet passion fruit and a bit of "blackness". Flavor is really nice, fairly sweet but amply hopped, tastes like tropical fruit juice with just a hint of coffee at the end and a fairly ample bitterness. A solid black ipa.
bomber from wlvliquors. delicious balance of roasty, hoppy. nice creamy mouth feel. didnÂ’t get any honey. i understand "black", but why "tuna"?

22 oz. bottle. Blackish pour with a thick tan head. Lots of fluffy lacing, decent head retention. The aroma is so strong I can smell it from the table. Big, bright dank hop notes, pine, floral and resin notes as well. Very mild roast notes. Some herbal and mild sweet honey notes. Flavor is bitter, hoppy, with mild honey sweetness. Some roast and toast malts. Full bodied, lively carbonation. Finishes hoppy and delicious. Excellent, wonderful beer.
